<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://Rook-io.slack.com).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

Is this a bug report or feature request?
<!-- Remove only one -->
* Bug Report

**Bug Report**

What happened:  By default, the min_size is set to "3" when building a 3 node OSD cluster using Rook.IO.  This is problematic since the cluster can no longer process I/O if a single OSD is lost.

root@rook-ceph-tools:/# ceph osd pool get my-store.rgw.buckets.data min_size
min_size: 3

What you expected to happen:  Expected "min_size=2" or the option to change that setting in object.yaml

How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->

Example cluster configuration that produces this issue...

**kubectl get pods -n=rook-ceph**
NAME                                     READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
rook-ceph-mgr0-d5f69ccc4-b4ksp           1/1       Running   0          1m
rook-ceph-mon0-q4wzg                     1/1       Running   0          2m
rook-ceph-mon1-xbzdm                     1/1       Running   0          2m
rook-ceph-mon2-fdhbm                     1/1       Running   0          2m
rook-ceph-osd-qvq4p                      1/1       Running   0          1m

rook-ceph-osd-z77nk                      1/1       Running   0          1m
rook-ceph-rgw-my-store-6746f9885-zpnjb   1/1       Running   0          3s
rook-ceph-tools                          1/1       Running   0          25s

**rados df**
POOL_NAME                  USED OBJECTS CLONES COPIES MISSING_ON_PRIMARY UNFOUND DEGRADED RD_OPS RD    WR_OPS WR

**ceph osd pool get my-store.rgw.buckets.data all**

* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):

title: Erasure coding pools should set min_size to the number of data chunks
